cards.flavor: Shala Na turned away from Anku, breathed deeply, and sheathed her blade. As she did, she felt herself slipping away from Urshad.
cards.name: Act of Treason
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

changes: 2024-03-01 — Is now a Snake instead of a Naga
cards.flavor:
“The Endak decorate themselves in gold, but it doesn't hide the venom in their hearts.”
—Shemesh, Nomad Chieftain
cards.name: Adorned Naga
cards.text: Civilized — Adorned Naga gets +2/+0 and has menace as long as you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment.

cards.name: Agriculture
cards.text:
(As this Discovery enters and after your draw step, add a progress counter. Stop after you've discovered.)
I, II — Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
Discovery — {4}: You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Anatomy
cards.text:
(As this Discovery enters and after your draw step, add a progress counter. Stop after you've discovered.)
I, II — Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Discovery — {2}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Anku the Primordial
cards.text:
Indestructible
Whenever Anku the Primordial attacks, defending player sacrifices an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land.

cards.flavor: The ankuliths and their ankulim progeny served as stark reminder to the inhabitants of Urshad that Anku's power was absolute. Now, however, the worldly gods have begun to test its limits.
cards.name: Ankulim Spawning
cards.text: Create two 1/1 red Elemental creature tokens.

cards.flavor: Many mortals believe that the ankuliths are Anku's blood, spilt during a battle against some unfathomable deity.
cards.name: Ankulith Shard
cards.text:
When Ankulith Shard enters the battlefield, draw a card.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Ankulithic Armaments
cards.text: Create two 1/1 red Elemental creature tokens. When you do, target creature you control gets +X/+X and gains trample until end of turn, where X is the number of Elementals you control.

cards.flavor:
“I wish that the camaarpeckers kept flies out of our cities too.”
—Balasi, Sannurian edificer
cards.name: Aridland Camaar
cards.text: When Aridland Camaar enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying.

cards.name: Ashen Persecutor
cards.text:
Flying, trample
When Ashen Persecutor enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card and you gain life equal to its mana value.

cards.name: Aspect of Darutu
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, create a 2/2 green Ox creature token.
{3}{W}, Tap three untapped Oxen you control: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.name: Aven Merchant
cards.text:
Flying
When Aven Merchant enters the battlefield, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)

cards.name: Aven Supervisor
cards.text:
Flying
Civilized — Whenever Aven Supervisor deals combat damage to a player, if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment, you may draw a card. If you do, discard a card.

cards.flavor: Crops grown in the fields at the Azutahn delta feed mouths all across the empires of Urshad.
cards.name: Azutah's Abundance
cards.text: Draw X cards, where X is the number of differently named lands you control.

changes: 2024-03-01 — Is now a Snake instead of a Naga
cards.flavor: His water nourishes Azutah's crops just as well as it washes away its foes.
cards.name: Azutahn Hydromancer
cards.text: When Azutahn Hydromancer enters the battlefield, you may return target creature with power X or less to its owner's hand, where X is the number of differently named lands you control.

cards.flavor: Lisseria and the soldiers of Kanaa mounts many great hunts against the lions and manticores of the Urud mountains. With such prey, it only takes a small folly for them to become the hunted.
cards.name: Battlescarred Predator

cards.flavor: Selezzar holds executions upon the Slaughtered Steps, to show what happens to those that cross the Endak.
cards.name: Behead
cards.text:
Destroy target creature.
Civilized — You gain 3 life if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment.

cards.flavor:
“May your body return to Anku's fire, but may your spirit live on in all our hearts now and forever.”
—Haban, Seeker of Sarratu
cards.name: Blazing Offerings
cards.text: Blazing Offerings deals 4 damage to target creature or planeswalker.

cards.name: Bloodsoaked Blades

cards.flavor:
“That Selezzar really loves to leave viscera lyin' ‘round the place, don't he?”
—Eli Windsors
cards.name: Bloodstained Ziggurat
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has “{T}: Each opponent loses 2 life.”

cards.name: Bone Mesa Marauder
cards.text:
Assault {1}{B} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Bone Mesa Marauder assaults, it gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Bordermakers
cards.text:
Vigilance, deathtouch
Civilized — When Bordermakers enters the battlefield, if you control a creature, an artifact, and an enchantment, each opponent loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.

cards.flavor: Before Emerabi and Sunnula's empire fell, his cattle plowed fields. Now, they bear his entire life on their backs.
cards.name: Borsuppa Drover
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from a creature you control: Create a 2/2 green Ox creature token.

cards.name: Borsuppa Outrider
cards.text:
Assault {R} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Borsuppa Outrider assaults, it deals 2 damage to each opponent.

cards.name: Borsuppa Scavenger
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Assault {R} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: The empire of Azutah burgeons with beautiful gardens, the delta blooming with flowers all colors of the rainbow.
cards.name: Bounty of the Gardens
cards.text: Create an X/X green and blue Plant creature token, where X is the number of differently named lands you control.

changes: 2023-11-01 — Now has trample instead of '{2}: gain trample until end of turn.'
cards.name: Breaker of Cities
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Breaker of Cities deals combat damage to a player, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token with vigilance.
Crew 1 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 1 or greater: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Burning Sulfur
cards.text:
Destroy target land an opponent controls. Its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: The special incense it carries causes a sense of overwhelming tranquility in those around it.
cards.name: Calming Dromoryx
cards.text: Permanents entering the battlefield don't cause abilities of permanents to trigger.

cards.name: Caprin Outlander
cards.text:
Assault {1}{G} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Caprin Outlander assaults, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Cartography
cards.text:
(As this Discovery enters and after your draw step, add a progress counter. Stop after you've discovered.)
I, II — Scry 2.
Discovery — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, if it doesn't have the same name as another land you control, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
“Look what we have built together.”
— Ekebram, to the other worldly gods
cards.name: Center of Culture
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
Civilized — {T}: Add {C}{C}. Activate only if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment.

cards.flavor:
“Anku sends locusts to devour our crops, and yet some among you still consider him worth worship?”
—Sumun, Azutah's Heart
cards.name: Chittering Swarm
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Choking Dunes
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
At the beginning of your end step, Choking Dunes deals X damage to any target, where X is the number of land cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor:
“I always loved the feelin' of ridin' along in the dust of a tremorworm trail.”
—Eli Windsors
cards.name: Churning Sandwurms
cards.text: When Churning Sandwurms enters the battlefield, remove all counters from target permanent. Put a +1/+1 counter on Churning Sandwurms for each counter removed this way.

cards.flavor: Lhosei quickly found that Urshad was a world in no short supply of daring deeds.
cards.name: Collapse the Pillars
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment with mana value 4 or less.

cards.name: Conscription
cards.text:
(As this Discovery enters and after your draw step, add a progress counter. Stop after you've discovered.)
I, II — Create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token with vigilance.
Discovery — At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may pay {2}{W}. If you do, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“You won't like what they say.”
—Balasi, Sannurian edificer
cards.name: Consult the Scriptures
cards.text:
Civilized — This spell costs {1} less to cast if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment.
Counter target spell.

cards.flavor: “Inishtu can keep their souls, but their succulent flesh will stay with me.”
cards.name: Corpse Herder
cards.text: {T}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from a creature you control: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.flavor: Ekebram made sure that Sannuria welcomed Shala Na and Nikanuur.
cards.name: Court Sponsor
cards.text: Whenever another creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control for the first time each turn, you may pay {W}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: Cradle of Civilization
cards.text:
Enchant land
When Cradle of Civilization enters the battlefield, search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
Enchanted land has “{T}: Add one mana of any color.”

cards.name: Crescent of Possibilities
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{3}, {T}: Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.flavor: “You would treat me with such contempt over the trifling amount of silver I owe you?”
cards.name: Crooked Merchant
cards.text: When Crooked Merchant dies, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)

cards.name: Crushclaw Pulverizer
cards.text:
Assault {3}{G} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Crushclaw Pulverizer assaults, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Currency
cards.text:
(As this Discovery enters and after your draw step, add a progress counter. Stop after you've discovered.)
I, II — Create a tapped Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)
Discovery — {2}, Sacrifice an artifact: Draw a card.

cards.name: Cycle of Creation
cards.text:
Exile all creatures. Exile Cycle of Creation with X genesis counters on it, where X is the number of creatures exiled this way.
Whenever you cast a spell, if Cycle of Creation is in exile, you may remove a genesis counter from it. If you do, create a 1/1 white Human creature token.

cards.flavor: Anku's worshipers refuse to raise blades on the final day of each month, believing it to be a sacred day of peace.
cards.name: Day of Rest
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn except by creatures you control with +1/+1 counters on them.

cards.name: Death Pits Hawker
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever another creature you control dies, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Death Pits Trophy
Dehmi, Origin Seeker
cards.text:
Flash
When Dehmi, Origin Seeker enters the battlefield, counter target spell an opponent controls unless that spell's controller has you create X 1/1 red Elemental creature tokens, where X is that spell's mana value.

cards.flavor:
“See how this creature treats me like its master, and imagine how wonderful this world could be if all of creation did the same.”
—Dehmi, Origin Seeker
cards.name: Dehmi's Servitor
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: Even the camaar don't venture into the deepest parts of the Urshadi deserts.
cards.name: Dehydrate
cards.text:
Enchant non-Camel creature
When Dehydrate enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

cards.name: Delugic Surger
cards.text: When Delugic Surger enters the battlefield, if you control another Elemental, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Deserted Trail
cards.text:
As Deserted Trail enters the battlefield, you may reveal a Swamp or Forest card from your hand. If you don't, Deserted Trail enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {G}.

cards.name: Despoiler of Civilization
cards.text:
Assault {1}{B} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever a creature you control assaults, you may have target creature get -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: “I've seen the way Emerabi and Sunnula look at each other. With such passion, our enemies don't stand a chance.”
cards.name: Devoted Nomad
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control assaults, put a +1/+1 counter on Devoted Nomad.

cards.flavor: Hannaru's battle chariot gleams with the golden rays of the midday sun.
cards.name: Divine Chariot
cards.text:
Lifelink
Crew 2 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 2 or greater: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: After the Mending, Anku lost the power to break worlds, but his magic could still shatter lives.
cards.name: Divine Verdict
cards.text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Dominate the Desert
cards.text:
When Dominate the Desert enters the battlefield, create a 3/3 green Elephant creature token with trample.
Whenever a creature you control assaults, you may return Dominate the Desert to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: In a hero's hands, anything can be a weapon that stories will be sung about.
cards.name: Donkey Jawbone

changes: 2024-03-01 — Is now a Snake instead of a Naga
cards.name: Dryscale Dissidents
cards.text:
Assault {1}{R} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever a creature you control assaults, creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Dune Tromper
cards.text:
Assault {1}{G} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Dune Tromper assaults, it gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Edge of the Empires
cards.text:
Defender
Civilized — {T}: Edge of the Empires deals 1 damage to each opponent. Activate only if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment.

cards.name: Edifice Overseer
cards.text:
Flying
Civilized — Whenever Edifice Overseer attacks, if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment, other attacking creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Ekebram's Archive
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Draw a card, then exile a card from your hand face down.
You may look at cards exiled with Ekebram's Archive.
{4}, {T}, Sacrifice Ekebram's Archive: Return all cards exiled with Ekebram's Archive to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Ekebram's Scribe
cards.text: When Ekebram's Scribe enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.flavor:
Ekebram was the first to press words
into a clay tablet.
cards.id: Ekebram the Scholar//Ekebram, Chronicler of Ages_SOU
cards.name: Ekebram the Scholar
cards.text:
Whenever Ekebram the Scholar becomes untapped, draw a card.
Whenever you draw your third card each turn, you may transform Ekebram.

cards.flavor: Now, he etches the deeds and legacies of every great hero on Urshad.
cards.id: Ekebram the Scholar//Ekebram, Chronicler of Ages_SOU
cards.name: Ekebram, Chronicler of Ages
cards.text:
Indestructible
Whenever a creature you control becomes untapped, draw a card.

cards.flavor: Eli had already killed so many in Marianne's name. What was a god to add to that tally?
cards.name: Eli's Defiance
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Each opponent sacrifices a nonlegendary creature.
• Each opponent sacrifices a legendary creature or planeswalker.

cards.name: Eli's Grit
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to another target creature or planeswalker.
• Target planeswalker you control deals damage equal to the number of loyalty counters on it to target creature or planeswalker.

changes: 2023-03-01 — Mana cost is now {2}{B} (from {1}{B}{B}), his starting loyalty has been increased to 4 (from 3) and his -2 is now a -1.
cards.name: Eli Windsors, Lone Gun
cards.text:
[+1]: Create a tapped colorless Bullet artifact token with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: It deals 1 damage to any target.”
[-1]: Exile target creature or planeswalker that was dealt damage this turn.
[-7]: You get an emblem with “At the beginning of each end step, you may draw X cards, where X is the amount of life your opponents lost this turn.”

cards.flavor:
“So the worldly gods see a great destiny for you. Doesn't that sound wonderful?”
—Nikanuur, to Shala Na
cards.name: Embers of Prophecy
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has “{T}: Exile the top card of your library. If it's a nonland card, you may cast that card this turn.”

cards.name: Emerabi's Disciple
cards.text:
Trample
Assault {2}{R}{G} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
If one or more +1/+1 counters would be put on a creature you control, that many plus one +1/+1 counters are put on it instead.

cards.name: Emerabi and Sunnula
cards.text:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, create a 1/1 red Nomad creature token with haste.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control five or more creatures, you may transform Emerabi and Sunnula.

cards.name: The Divine Lovers
cards.text:
Indestructible
At the beginning of your upkeep or when this creature transforms into The Divine Lovers, gain control of target permanent with mana value X or less until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control. Untap that permanent. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Emerging Ankulim
cards.text: When Emerging Ankulim enters the battlefield, return each non-Elemental creature to its owner's hand, then Emerging Ankulim deals damage to each player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.

cards.flavor: Sometimes unfathomability can be mistaken for divinity.
cards.name: Emissary of Dark Tides
cards.text:
Flash
When Emissary of Dark Tides enters the battlefield, you may return target noncreature spell or tapped creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: “Steal a farmer's crop, and you feed yourself for a day. Enslave a farmer, and you feed yourself for life.”
cards.name: Endak City Slavedriver
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Endak City Slavedriver. Activate only as a sorcery.

cards.flavor: The sand of the Endak imperial arena is sodden with the blood of thousands.
cards.name: Endak Death Pits
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has “{T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Activate only as a sorcery.”

cards.flavor: Bloody melees that last hours are fought in in the Endak imperial arena, with gladiators fighting for their own survival.
cards.name: Endak Savagery
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has trample.

cards.name: Epic of Anku
cards.text:
Choose X. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Epic of Anku deals 4 damage to each creature.
• You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
• Return target nonplaneswalker permanent card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Epic of Ekebram
cards.text:
Choose X. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
• Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
• Target player draws a card.

cards.name: Epic of Hannaru
cards.text:
Choose X. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• You gain 2 life.
• Create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token with vigilance.
• Exile target creature you control, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.name: Epic of Inishtu
cards.text:
Choose X. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Each opponent discards a card.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Epic of Jobiah
cards.text:
Choose X. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature you control.
• Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
• Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Epic of the Lovers
cards.text:
Choose X. You may choose the same mode more than once.
• Epic of the Lovers deals 1 damage to any target.
• Create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)
• You may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor: The empires on Urshad are always seeking to push their boundaries.
cards.name: Evolving Wilds
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

cards.name: Fall in Line
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, gain control of target creature an opponent controls with power less than the greatest power among creatures you control until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Flourishing Waterways
cards.text:
As Flourishing Waterways enters the battlefield, you may reveal a Forest or Island card from your hand. If you don't, Flourishing Waterways enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {U}.

cards.flavor: “This city won't fall while I still stand.”
cards.name: Founding Hero
cards.text: Civilized — Whenever Founding Hero attacks, if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment, Founding Hero gains double strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Funerary Barge
cards.text:
Whenever a creature you control dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Funerary Barge.
Crew 1 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 1 or greater: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: Imperial temples to the god Inishtu function as hospitals, mortuaries, and graveyards. With each new burial, the worshipers join in prayer so that its spirit may reach their master quickly and safely.
cards.name: Funerary Servant
Gilded Authority
cards.text:
When Gilded Authority enters the battlefield, create two Treasure tokens. (They're artifacts with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)
Creatures your opponents control get -1/-0.

cards.name: Gilded Blade
cards.text:
Flash
When Gilded Blade enters the battlefield, you may attach it to target creature you control.
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
Equip {1}

cards.flavor: Idols to Darutu and the other ancient primordial spirits of Urshad have largely been torn down and replaced by shrines to the worldly gods, but pockets of their worship still remain.
cards.name: Gilded Idol
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.flavor:
“I . . . I cannot face this fate alone.”
“Fear not, my child; you won't have to.”
cards.name: Glimpse of Fate
cards.text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. If you control an Elemental, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
“I moved to kneel before Queen Hannaru, but she shook her head and took my hand. She didn't want my reverence; only to know that I wanted to serve.”
—Lisseria, General of Kanaa
cards.name: Godchosen Valor
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Golden Age
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, create a Treasure token. Then if you control fifteen or more artifacts, creatures, and/or enchantments, you win the game. (Treasure tokens are artifacts with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)

cards.flavor: Lhosei came to Urshad in desperation, seeking a way to slay a monster and save her family.
cards.name: Grapple with the Past
cards.text: Mill three cards, then you may return a creature or land card from your graveyard to your hand. (To mill three cards, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.)

cards.flavor: Shrines to Anku still have a place among the empires, but worship of the wordly gods grows more and more with each of their divine acts.
cards.name: Halls of Worship
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has “{T}: Tap target creature.”

cards.name: Hannaru's Courage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Hannaru's Courage enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token with vigilance.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.

cards.name: Hannaru's Spear
Harbinger of Locusts
cards.text:
Flying
Assault {2}{B} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Harbinger of Locusts assaults, you may search your library for an Insect card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.flavor: Not all of the backs that help to build empires are carried upon two legs.
cards.name: Hard-Working Oxen
cards.text: Civilized — Hard-Working Oxen gets +3/+0 as long as you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment.

cards.name: Harrow
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

cards.name: Harshapal Banner
Hauling Hippopotamus
cards.text:
Defender
Civilized — As long as you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment, Hauling Hippopotamus can attack as though it didn't have defender.

cards.flavor:
“You have my word, nomad, that you will not be harmed on the streets of my empire.”
—Sumun, Heart of Azutah
cards.name: Heartland's Protection
cards.text: Target permanent you control gains hexproof until end of turn. If that permanent is a creature, it also gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Even in the courts, a Sannurian lawmaker is never truly without a weapon.
cards.name: Hefty Tablet
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each card in your hand.
Equip {3}

cards.flavor: Anku first shaped the primordial elements to create the world. His ankulim now seek to bring about its end.
cards.name: Herald of Ankulim
cards.text: Elemental, instant, and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Hila Emergence
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Enchant land
At the beginning of combat on your turn, untap enchanted land. It becomes a 6/6 green Lizard creature with haste until end of turn. It's still a land.

cards.name: Hilaback Outriders
cards.text:
Assault {B} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Hilaback Outriders assaults, it gains menace until end of turn.

cards.flavor: He will only cut his locks when defeated in battle, leading many to believe the long hair makes him invincible.
cards.name: Hirsute Champion
cards.text: Civilized — As long as you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to Hirsute Champion.

cards.name: Horizon of Origins
cards.text:
As Horizon of Origins enters the battlefield, you may reveal an Island or Mountain card from your hand. If you don't, Horizon of Origins enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {R}.

cards.flavor: Her flock is her empire.
cards.name: Humble Shepherd
cards.text:
When Humble Shepherd enters the battlefield, create a 0/1 white Sheep creature token.
{T}, Tap an untapped Sheep you control: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Husbandry
cards.text:
(As this Discovery enters and after your draw step, add a progress counter. Stop after you've discovered.)
I, II — Create a 3/3 green Beast creature token with defender.
Discovery — Creatures you control with defender can attack as though they didn't have defender.

cards.flavor: Sannuria's greatest figures are immortalized in stone among the courts.
cards.name: Immortalize
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1, has flying and lifelink, and is a legendary artifact in addition to its other types.

cards.name: Imperator Namuzzar
cards.text:
Flying
When Imperator Namuzzar enters the battlefield, search your library for an artifact or enchantment card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
Civilized — Lammasu you control get +2/+2 and have hexproof as long as you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment.

cards.flavor:
“Once, I wondered what Mariane saw in this place. Now I'm finally startin' to realize.”
—Eli Windsors
cards.name: Imperial Achievement
cards.text:
Draw a card.
Civilized — Instead draw two cards if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment.

cards.name: Imperial Barracks
cards.text:
As Imperial Barracks enters the battlefield, you may reveal a Mountain or Plains card from your hand. If you don't, Imperial Barracks enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {W}.

cards.name: Imperial Brutality
cards.text:
All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
Civilized — Instead only creatures your opponents control get -2/-2 until end of turn if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment.

cards.flavor: “Fear not. You will be compensated adequately.”
cards.name: Imperial Claim
cards.text: Exile target artifact or enchantment. Its controller creates a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)

cards.flavor: “Your blood will seal this pact in Inishtu's name.”
cards.name: Imperial Confidant
cards.text: Civilized — At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Imperial Defenses
cards.text:
If a source an opponent controls would deal 2 or more damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
Civilized — Instead prevent all but 1 of that damage if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment.

cards.flavor: The worldly gods seek to bring peace and prosperity to the empires of Urshad.
cards.name: Imperial Prosperity
cards.text: Draw a card. Create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)

cards.id: Inishtu, Desert Healer//Inishtu, Herald of the Dead_SOU
cards.name: Inishtu, Desert Healer
cards.text:
Whenever Inishtu, Desert Healer enters the battlefield or attacks, surveil 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, if seven or more cards are in your graveyard, you may transform Inishtu.

cards.flavor: He now presides over his former patients' restful dominion.
cards.id: Inishtu, Desert Healer//Inishtu, Herald of the Dead_SOU
cards.name: Inishtu, Herald of the Dead
cards.text:
Indestructible
{2}{B}, Exile two cards from your graveyard: Each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor:
“May our marches be short, our battles shorter, and our celebrations of victory eternal!”
—Kanaan battle prayer to Hannaru
cards.name: Inspired Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Into the Lion's Den
cards.text: When Into the Lion's Den enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it and exile that card until Into the Lion's Den leaves the battlefield.

cards.name: Invoke the Ankuliths
cards.text: Look at the top eight cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield and exile an instant or sorcery card from among them. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. As long as that creature is on the battlefield, whenever it deals combat damage to a player, copy the exiled card and you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor: Hydromancy keeps Azutahn crops flourishing even during the dry seasons.
cards.name: Irrigation Channels
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has “{T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.”

cards.name: Jobiah, Devoted Farmer
cards.text:
When Jobiah, Devoted Farmer enters the battlefield, search your library for a land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control six or more lands with different names, you may transform Jobiah.

cards.name: Jobiah the World-Shepherd
cards.text:
Indestructible
At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may untap target land you control. If you do, that land becomes an X/X green Beast creature with haste until end of turn, where X is the number of differently named lands you control. It's still a land.

cards.flavor: The soldiers of Kanaa fight together as one, with each encouraging the others to achieve their best.
cards.name: Kanaan Wardriver
cards.text: {T}: Kanaan Wardriver deals 1 damage to target creature you control. That creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Keeper of Codices
cards.text:
Flash
When Keeper of Codices enters the battlefield, you may exile target artifact or enchantment you control. If you do, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Lammasu Roost
cards.text:
When Lammasu Roost enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 blue Lammasu creature token with flying.
{3}{U}: Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Legacy Foundations
cards.text:
As Legacy Foundations enters the battlefield, you may reveal a Plains or Swamp card from your hand. If you don't, Legacy Foundations enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {B}.

cards.name: Legacy Warmask
Lhosei of the Ghost Peak
cards.text:
[+1]: Until your next turn, another target non-Aura permanent becomes a land with “{T}: Add one mana of any color” and loses all other card types and abilities.
[-2]: Create a 1/1 blue Spirit creature token with flying. Draw a card.
[-7]: You get an emblem with “At the beginning of your end step, create a 6/6 green and blue Spirit Warrior creature token with trample named Echo of Lhosei.”

cards.flavor:
“Turns out it wasn't much.”
—Selezzar, Tyrant of Endak
cards.name: Life's Worth
cards.text: Destroy target creature. Create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)

cards.name: Lisseria, General of Kanaa
cards.text:
Trample, haste
Whenever Lisseria, General of Kanaa attacks, you may exchange its power with the power of target creature defending player controls until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Lisseria's drills ensure that the Kanaan armies are never more than minutes away from being mobilized for the battlefield.
cards.name: Lisseria's Outfitter
cards.text: Aura and Equipment spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.flavor: Anku's wrath drove Emerabi, Sunnula, and their people into the harsh desert.
cards.name: Long Journey
cards.text: When Long Journey enters the battlefield, exile target creature or planeswalker an opponent controls until Long Journey leaves the battlefield.

cards.name: Look to the Future
cards.text:
Take an extra turn after this one. Exile Look to the Future.
Civilized — If you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment, until the end of your next turn, you may look at the top card of your library any time and you may play the top card of your library.

cards.flavor: A bountiful crop makes for a bountiful people.
cards.name: Lush Delta
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has “{T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. Activate only as a sorcery.”

cards.flavor: If the Seekers of Sarrutu could harness the power of the ankuliths, then they could wield some of Anku's world-shaping magic.
cards.name: Manalith
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.flavor: “She's good at swimming, fishing, and even cutting the crops during harvest season. Everyone should have one!”
cards.name: Mangrove Fisher
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.name: Many-Voiced Tower
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color. Spend this mana only to cast a legendary spell or activate an ability of a legendary permanent.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Many-Voiced Tower: Search your library for a legendary card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Activate only if you control five or more differently named lands.

cards.flavor: Goliaths are savage and dangerous remnants of past cycles on Urshad.
cards.name: Marauding Goliath
cards.text: When Marauding Goliath becomes blocked by a creature with power 1 or less, sacrifice it at end of combat.

cards.flavor: “These new tinctures have saved many lives today. Inishtu would be proud.”
cards.name: Marble Row Healer
cards.text: Civilized — When Marble Row Healer enters the battlefield, if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment, you gain 4 life.

cards.artist: Jㅇㅇ d r a w s — edit
cards.name: Marrow Cruncher
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, exile the top card of your library. You may play that card until the beginning of your next end step.

cards.name: Master of Marble Row
cards.text:
When Master of Marble Row enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Create a colorless Monument artifact token with “Creatures you control get +1/+1.”
• Create a white Cloister enchantment token with “When this enchantment enters the battlefield, exile target nonland permanent an opponent controls until this enchantment leaves the battlefield.”

cards.name: Medicine
cards.text:
(As this Discovery enters and after your draw step, add a progress counter. Stop after you've discovered.)
I, II — Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
Discovery — Creatures you control with +1/+1 counters on them have lifelink.

changes: 2024-03-01 — Is now a Snake instead of a Naga
cards.name: Merchant of Flesh
cards.text:
Whenever Merchant of Flesh or another creature you control dies, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)
{B}, Sacrifice two Treasures: Each opponent sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Metallurgy
cards.text:
(As this Discovery enters and after your draw step, add a progress counter. Stop after you've discovered.)
I, II — Target creature you control gets +2/+0 and gains menace until end of turn.
Discovery — Attacking creatures you control get +2/+0 and have menace.

cards.name: Monstrous Hila
cards.text:
Assault {2}{R} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Monstrous Hila assaults, it deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: Humans rub shoulders with caprin and naga on the streets of Azutah.
cards.name: Multiculturalism
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, if it shares no creature types with other creatures you control, draw a card.

cards.flavor: The new recruits at Harshapal endure the longest walks to drills at its pinnacle.
cards.name: Mustering Grounds
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
Whenever Mustering Grounds becomes tapped, if it's enchanted, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token with vigilance.

cards.name: Mythology
cards.text:
(As this Discovery enters and after your draw step, add a progress counter. Stop after you've discovered.)
I, II — Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal a permanent card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
Discovery — At the beginning of your end step, you may put a permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.

changes: 2024-03-01 — Is now a Snake instead of a Naga
cards.flavor: “This one treats scorpid venom, this one soothes sand sickness. This one? This one just looks pretty.”
cards.name: Naga Cultivator
cards.text: When Naga Cultivator enters the battlefield, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Nameless Throng
cards.text:
Nameless Throng can't block.
{1}{B}, Exile an artifact or enchantment card from your graveyard: Return Nameless Throng from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Namuzzar's Disciple
cards.text:
Flying
Civilized — Whenever Namuzzar's Disciple attacks, if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment, put a +1/+1 counter on Namuzzar's Disciple.

cards.name: Namuzzar's Iterator
cards.text:
Flying
When Namuzzar's Iterator enters the battlefield, you may return an artifact or enchantment you control to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Once, an ancient tyrant visited Urshad from a far-away world. Selezzar keeps the spiked servants he had built for him around for their skills at slaughter.
cards.name: Nibinem's Hand
Oasis Claimer
cards.text:
Trample
Assault {1}{G} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.

cards.name: Obviate
cards.text: Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library. Create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)

cards.name: Oppress the Weak
cards.text:
Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
Civilized — Draw a card if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment.

cards.flavor: Ankulim spawning grounds make bad sites for treasure vaults.
cards.name: Opulent Ankulim
cards.text: Whenever you cast your first instant or sorcery spell each turn, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)

cards.name: Paid in Blood
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Paid in Blood enters the battlefield, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has lifelink.

cards.name: Palace Enforcer
cards.text:
First strike
Civilized — Whenever Palace Enforcer attacks, if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment, Palace Enforcer gains deathtouch and lifelink until end of turn.

cards.name: Parted Waters
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has “{T}: When target creature deals combat damage to an opponent this turn, draw a card. Activate only as a sorcery.”

cards.flavor:
“The lammasu think themselves safe in the desert, arrogant on their wings. They aren't.”
—Shemesh, nomad chieftain
cards.name: Pierce the Sky
cards.text: Pierce the Sky deals 7 damage to target creature with flying.

cards.flavor:
“Is it blasphemy to say that Lisseria's skills rival even that of the gods?”
—Nanish, Kanaan commander
cards.name: Piercing Blow
cards.text: Unattach all Equipment from target creature. Piercing Blow deals 3 damage to that creature.

cards.flavor: All the flesh and stone in Endak belongs to Selezzar, and Selezzar alone.
cards.name: Pound by Pound
cards.text:
Return target artifact or creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Some ankulim cannot be bound.
cards.name: Primordial Manifestation
cards.text:
{U}: Primordial Manifestation gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
Whenever Primordial Manifestation deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.

cards.flavor: The Seekers of Sarrutu believe that the mortal gods are false prophets, instead seeking to truly understand Anku.
cards.name: Primordial Progenitor
cards.text: When Primordial Progenitor dies, create two 1/1 red Elemental creature tokens.

cards.name: Protect the Farm
cards.text:
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token with vigilance.
{4}{G}{W}, Sacrifice Protect the Farm: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Queen Hannaru
cards.text:
Whenever Queen Hannaru enters the battlefield or attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on another target creature you control.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are four or more +1/+1 counters among creatures you control, you may transform Queen Hannaru.

cards.flavor: Hannaru's campaigns united the disparate clans of the northern deserts into the empire of Kanaa.
cards.name: Hannaru the Conqueror
cards.text:
Indestructible
Whenever Hannaru the Conqueror attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.flavor: The craftspeople of Rabudan Square are the foundation stones of Sannuria.
cards.name: Rabudan Chiseler
cards.text: When Rabudan Chiseler enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Aura or Equipment card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.name: Rhudai Fieldtiller
cards.text:
Rhudai Fieldtiller gets +1/+1 for each enchanted land you control.
At the beginning of your end step, untap each enchanted land you control.

changes: 2024-03-01 — Is now a Snake instead of a Naga
cards.name: Rhudai Overseer
cards.text: When Rhudai Overseer enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal an artifact or enchantment card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Rhudai Pathfinder
cards.text: {1}{G}: Rhudai Pathfinder gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of differently named lands you control. Activate only once each turn.

cards.flavor: “Warfare isn't much different from threshing a crop. Both involve clearing away the chaff.”
cards.name: Rhudai Swathcutter
cards.text: Whenever Rhudai Swathcutter attacks, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

cards.name: Rod of Marble Row

cards.flavor: Over time, the ichor from their fangs infuses the fruit of their groves with a concentrated, rancid vigor.
cards.name: Rottenfruit Coiler
cards.text: Deathtouch

changes: 2022-10-01 — Now searches for "an Aura that could enchant a land you control".
cards.name: Ruler of Cities
cards.text:
When Ruler of Cities enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Aura that could enchant a land you control, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
Whenever an Aura becomes attached to a land you control, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Rupture Spire
cards.text:
Rupture Spire enters the battlefield tapped.
When Rupture Spire enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you pay {1}.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.flavor: The progress of civilization is a road paved with the bones of the weak.
cards.name: Ruthless Advancement
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact or creature.
Draw two cards.

cards.name: Sacrificial Bull
cards.text:
{G}: Exile target card from a graveyard. If it was a land card, put a +1/+1 counter on Sacrificial Bull.
{G}, Sacrifice Sacrificial Bull: You gain life equal to its power.

cards.flavor:
Farming by the old desert.
—Urshadi saying meaning “to have a death wish”
cards.name: Sandburst
cards.text: Destroy target land. Sandburst deals 1 damage to each creature without flying your opponents control.

cards.flavor:
“The life I create helps my people to prosper. Why doesn't the life that springs from the ankuliths do the same?”
—Balasi, Sannurian edificer
cards.name: Sannurian Sentinel
cards.text: Trample

cards.flavor:
“Legends say that Anku tore down countless versions of our world. We will prove to him that we are worthy enough to survive.”
—Mesha, Sannurian storyteller
cards.name: Sannurian Storyteller
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Sarrutu Flamebinder
cards.text:
Whenever one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
{2}{R}, {T}, Exile two cards from your graveyard: Sarrutu Flamebinder deals 2 damage to any target.

cards.name: Sarrutu Worldbinder
cards.text:
When Sarrutu Worldbinder enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 red Elemental creature tokens.
{1}{U}, {T}: Elementals you control gain flying until end of turn.
{2}{R}, {T}: Elementals you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Emerabi and Sunnula's people were forced to adapt to life in Urshad's deserts or die. In doing so, they found a new strength within themselves.
cards.name: Savage Takedown
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Scavenger's Wagon
cards.text:
{3}, {T}: Draw a card.
Crew 3 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 3 or greater: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Scavenging Hilakites
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Scavenging Hilakites attacks, you may sacrifice another creature. When you do, Scavenging Hilakites deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target.

cards.flavor: He's always on the lookout for new monument building sites.
cards.name: Scion of Sannuria
cards.text:
Flying
Civilized — Scion of Sannuria has vigilance as long as you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment.

cards.flavor: Stingbrood venom is highly prized in Endak, but obtaining it is an extremely difficult endeavor.
cards.name: Scorpid Sniper
cards.text: When Scorpid Sniper enters the battlefield, you may have target creature get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“The desert sands hold whispers of ancient cycles and a maker's flame.”
— Dehmi, Origin Seeker
cards.name: Secrets of Creation
cards.text: Scry 2, then draw two cards. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Seeker Amalgam
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
When Seeker Amalgam enters the battlefield, you may counter target spell with mana value less than or equal to the number of Elementals you control.

changes: 2024-03-01 — Is now a Snake instead of a Naga
cards.name: Selezzar, Tyrant of Endak
cards.text:
At the beginning of your end step, for each opponent, destroy up to one target creature that player controls with power less than or equal to the amount of life that player lost this turn.
{3}{R}: Selezzar, Tyrant of Endak deals 2 damage to each opponent.

cards.name: Serpent Staff
Serve the Empire
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
Civilized — Enchanted creature can't block and its activated abilities can't be activated if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment.

cards.name: Shala Na, Urshadi Apostate
cards.text:
[+1]: Up to two target creatures you control each get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
[0]: You may sacrifice a creature. If you do, Shala Na, Urshadi Apostate deals 3 damage to any target.
[-3]: Discard your hand, then draw three cards.

cards.flavor: The Mending severed Anku's direct connection to Urshad's ankulim, but it did little to diminish their urge to break civilization.
cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: Shemesh and his giant hila Musha lead the nomads under the Divine Lovers.
cards.name: Shemesh, Nomad Chieftain
cards.text:
Assault {2}{R}{G} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Shemesh assaults, other creatures you control get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“I hope he enjoys the work, but really I suspect he's just in it for the bones.”
—Gemeti, Azutahn farmer
cards.name: Shepherd's Companion
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you may tap target creature.

cards.flavor:
“Look at the power these small pieces of ankulith bestow upon me, and you'll understand why this is the path we must walk to save ourselves.”
— Dehmi, Origin Seeker
cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.

cards.name: Sire of Empires
cards.text:
Flying
Sire of Empires gets +1/+1 as long as you control another creature, has lifelink as long as you control an enchantment, and has vigilance as long as you control an artifact.

cards.flavor:
“Despite all we've had to contend with, we won't ever break. With Sunnula at my side and the support of our people, a reckoning will come for Anku in time.”
—Emerabi
cards.name: Skittering Solifuge
cards.text: Reach

cards.name: Slaughtered Steps Taskmaster
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Whenever Slaughtered Steps Taskmaster attacks, you may sacrifice another creature. If you do, Slaughtered Steps Taskmaster gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Sling of the Meek

cards.flavor:
“Sometimes I wish that I could spread my wings, and just fly away from all this expectation the gods have placed on me.”
—Shala Na, to Nikanuur
cards.name: Soaring Roc
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: “With blood spilt, Inishtu will reveal to us who is false and who is righteous.”
cards.name: Solemn Judgment
cards.text: Target opponent separates all creatures into two piles. You choose one of those piles. For each creature in the chosen pile, its controller sacrifices it.

cards.flavor:
“The gods do not demand sacrifices. We offer them freely, for the good they have done our empires.”
—Balasi, Sannurian edificer
cards.name: Solemn Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.

cards.flavor:
“I know you always loved the way the Urshadi sunset looked, Mariane. Now, you can watch it every single night.”
—Eli Windsors
cards.name: Sorrowful Memories
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.

cards.flavor: As the empires spread, they drove out the savage creatures of the wild. However, some still lurk in the ancient places, biding their time until presented with an opportunity for revenge.
cards.name: Spawn of the Guardian

cards.flavor:
“Anku must be stopped before he obliterates our world. That does not mean the position of creator need stay vacant after the fact.”
—Dehmi, Origin Seeker
cards.name: Spell Pierce
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {2}.

cards.flavor: Before Jobiah ascended, the Azutahns worshiped the sky-ox Darutu and his great herd of harvest spirits.
cards.name: Spirit of the Harvest
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, target creature gains your choice of flying or lifelink until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Ankulim are born from the very heart of Urshad itself. Those that emerge from the deserts and mountains are stony in form, but those formed from the oceans harness the power of water.
cards.name: Splinter of Anku

cards.flavor: Each world begins with a single splinter.
cards.name: Splinter of Creation
cards.text:
When Splinter of Creation enters the battlefield, you may exile any number of land cards from your graveyard.
You may play lands exiled with Splinter of Creation.

cards.flavor: The Stingbrood scorpids are a reclusive people; while some joined up with Emerabi and Sunnula after they were driven into the desert, most react to trespassers with a flurry of claws and stings.
cards.name: Stingbrood Assailant
cards.text: Deathtouch

cards.name: Stingbrood Warlord
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Sacrifice another creature: Stingbrood Warlord gains deathtouch until end of turn.

cards.name: Stolen Innovations
cards.text:
When Stolen Innovations enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals their hand. You choose an instant or sorcery card from that player's hand or graveyard and exile it.
You may cast each spell you cast from your hand as a copy of the exiled card. You may spend mana as though it were mana of any color to cast spells this way.

cards.flavor:
“Balasi captured my beard extremely well, don't you think?”
— Imperator Nammuzar
cards.name: Stonecut Lammasu
cards.text:
Flying
Tap an artifact you control, a creature you control, and an enchantment you control: Return Stonecut Lammasu from your graveyard to your hand. Activate only as a sorcery.

cards.flavor: Rhox nomads rarely show up to market, but when they do they drive the hardest bargains.
cards.name: Strongarm
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+1 and gains trample until end of turn. Create a tapped Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)

cards.name: Subjugator of Empires
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Civilized — Whenever Subjugator of Empires attacks, if you control an artifact, a creature, and an enchantment, each opponent discards a card, sacrifices a creature, and loses 3 life.

cards.flavor:
“I can feel Anku's contempt for us with every grain that scratches my throat.”
—Sunnula
cards.name: Suffocating Sands
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -3/-0 and can't block.

cards.flavor: “With my help, this land will achieve its true potential.”
cards.name: Sumun, Azutah's Heart
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, if you haven't had a land become a copy this way this turn, you may have that land enter the battlefield as a copy of any nonland permanent on the battlefield.

cards.flavor: “All of us have the hearts of gods!”
cards.name: Sunblessed Orator
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, Sunblessed Orator deals 1 damage to each opponent and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Sunnula's Firebird
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Assault {1}{R} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever one or more +1/+1 counters are put on a creature you control, you may return Sunnula's Firebird from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
“If the Lovers have chosen me to face Anku, then I will do my best to prove myself worthy.”
—Shala Na
cards.name: Sure Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: At the worldly god Jobiah's touch, even the driest desert sands can produce a glorious golden harvest.
cards.name: Sustaining Crops
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has “{W}, {T}: You gain 2 life.”

cards.flavor: Volcanic ankulim whose crusts have cooled can certainly pack a punch.
cards.name: Tempered Ankulim
cards.text:
When Tempered Ankulim enters the battlefield, choose one —
• You gain 2 life.
• Each opponent loses 2 life.

cards.flavor:
“Shala Na is strong; that much is clear. But will mortal strength be enough against Anku?”
—Inishtu, to the other worldly gods
cards.name: Test of Strength
cards.text: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn. It fights target creature you don't control.

cards.name: Theocracy
cards.text:
(As this Discovery enters and after your draw step, add a progress counter. Stop after you've discovered.)
I, II — Look at the top five cards of your library. Put up to one creature card with mana value 2 or less from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
Discovery — At the beginning of combat on your turn, tap target creature an opponent controls.

cards.name: Tiller's Adze

cards.flavor: Sannuria places a tax on its most wealthy to ensure the poor are fed.
cards.name: Tithe Official
cards.text:
First strike
Noncreature spells with mana value 4 or greater cost {1} more to cast.

cards.flavor: Shala Na froze as Anku emerged, engulfing both her friend Nikanuur and her faith in herself in a scourge of stone and fire.
cards.name: Torrent of Ankuliths
cards.text: Torrent of Ankuliths deals 5 damage to target creature. Create a 1/1 red Elemental creature token.

cards.name: Towering Hydraffe
cards.text:
Reach
Assault {5}{G}{G}{G} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Towering Hydraffe assaults, create a token that's a copy of it.

cards.name: Trace the Oasis
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
{3}{G}, Sacrifice Trace the Oasis: Draw cards equal to enchanted creature's power.

cards.name: Tradition
cards.text:
(As this Discovery enters and after your draw step, add a progress counter. Stop after you've discovered.)
I, II — Mill two cards. You gain 2 life. (Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.)
Discovery — During each of your turns, you may cast a permanent spell from your graveyard.

cards.flavor: Azutah farmers use beetles to dig great irrigation trenches that span countless miles.
cards.name: Trenchcutter Beetle
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.

cards.name: Trusty Camaar
cards.text:
Vigilance
Assault {G} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Exposure to the ankulith fields can leave careless Seekers to nasty fates.
cards.name: Turn to Salt
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Tyranny
cards.text:
(As this Discovery enters and after your draw step, add a progress counter. Stop after you've discovered.)
I, II — Each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
Discovery — At the beginning of your end step, you draw a card and you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Unbound Annihilus
cards.text:
Assault {X}{R}{R} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Other Elementals you control get +1/+0.
When Unbound Annihilus assaults, create X 1/1 red Elemental creature tokens that are tapped and attacking.

cards.name: Under the Gun
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player may discard their hand. If the player does, sacrifice Under the Gun. Otherwise, put a bullet counter on Under the Gun, then that player loses life equal to the number of bullet counters on it.

cards.flavor:
“That noose mighta' been meant for me, Marianne, but I guess it was your own life's string you cut short when you slit it.”
— Eli Windsors
cards.name: Urn of Heroes
cards.text:
When Urn of Heroes enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a legendary card, put that card into your graveyard, then shuffle.
{T}: Add {C}.

cards.flavor: Death can come in a second out in the treacherous Urud mountains.
cards.name: Urud Stingswoop
cards.text:
Haste
When Urud Stingswoop enters the battlefield, it gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Urudi Warlord
cards.text:
Assault {1}{R} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Urudi Warlord assaults, it gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Voyager's Ark
cards.text:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, create a token that's a copy of another target nonlegendary creature that crewed Voyager's Ark this turn. That token gains haste.
Crew 3 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 3 or greater: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

cards.name: Wandering Warden
cards.text:
Assault {G} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever a creature you control assaults, it gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The aven of Harshapal are amongst the best battle tacticians on Urshad.
cards.name: Warden of Harshapal Tower
cards.text:
Flying
Warden of Harshapal Tower's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.

cards.flavor: What mortals call miracles are simply like breathing for the worldly gods.
cards.name: Water into Wine
cards.text:
If you would gain life this turn, you gain twice that much life instead.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Wealthy Merchants
cards.text: When Wealthy Merchants enters the battlefield, create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)

cards.name: Wondrous Bazaar
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{3}, {T}: Create a Treasure token. (It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”)

cards.flavor: All of Urshad is his garden, and all the different beasts and birds his flowers.
cards.name: World Tender
cards.text:
Trample
World Tender's power and toughness are each equal to twice the number of differently named lands you control.

cards.name: Wretched Lammasu
cards.text:
Flying
Assault {2}{B} (Whenever this attacks, if it has no +1/+1 counters on it, you may pay its assault cost to put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Wretched Lammasu assaults, each opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Writing
cards.text:
(As this Discovery enters and after your draw step, add a progress counter. Stop after you've discovered.)
I, II — Draw a card.
Discovery — Noncreature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
